articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine is ready to sign a mineral resources deal with the United States and could do so later on Wednesday, a Ukrainian government source told Reuters.
articles.title: Kyiv ready to sign resources deal with US, Ukraine government source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said it carried out a strike in Syria against extremists who attacked members of the Druze community, following through on a promise to protect the minority group as sectarian violence spread near Damascus on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel says it hit extremists in Syria to protect Druze

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said the construction of a new bridge linking it to Russia is a "significant" development of relations between the two countries, state media KCNA reported on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea says new bridge to Russia reinforces economic cooperation

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Columbia University student Mohsen Mahdawi was released from U.S. immigration custody on Wednesday, after a judge ruled he should be free on bail to challenge the Trump administration's efforts to deport him over his participation in pro-Palestinian protests.
articles.title: Palestinian student released on bail as he challenges deportation from US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kremlin leader Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday it was up to residents of Volgograd to decide whether the city should revert to the name of Stalingrad, as it was called when Soviet forces defeated Nazi invaders in World War Two's bloodiest battle.
articles.title: Russia's Putin says reverting to Stalingrad name up to city residents

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is looking to make a trade deal and will visit the White House within the next week.
articles.title: Trump: Canada's Carney wants to make a deal, will visit White House soon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A new documentary from Oscar-winning director Martin Scorsese will feature a conversation with the late Pope Francis about an effort the pontiff championed to provide education through cinema, the film's producers said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Pope Francis interview with Scorsese featured in new documentary

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Islamabad said it condemned terrorism in all forms and will respond "assuredly and decisively" to any military action from India.
articles.title: Pakistan says intelligence suggests Indian military action likely soon

articles.author: David Stanway
articles.description: South Korea's worst ever wildfires in March were made twice as likely as a result of climate change and such disasters could become even more frequent if temperatures continue to rise, scientists said on Thursday.
articles.title: South Korea's deadly fires made twice as likely by climate change, researchers say

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: Many Venezuelan migrants accused by the Trump administration of belonging to Tren de Aragua are now being held at El Salvador's Terrorism Confinement Center.
articles.title: US judge limits Trump's ability to swiftly deport migrants held at Guantanamo Bay
